meanings.definition: A type of worm that feeds on leaves.
meanings.sent1: The garden was infested with leafworms, munching on the green leaves.
meanings.sent2: Leafworms can cause damage to plants by eating their leaves.
meanings.sent3: The leafworms had a feast on the salad leaves, leaving only stems behind.
meanings.sent4: The leafworms were like tiny leaf-eating machines, clearing the foliage in no time.
meanings.sent5: The farmer had to protect his crops from the leafworms to ensure a good harvest.

meanings.definition: The plural form of leafworm, referring to multiple worms that feed on leaves.
meanings.sent1: In the forest, leafworms were everywhere, devouring the lush greenery.
meanings.sent2: After the rain, the ground was covered with leafworms crawling over fallen leaves.
meanings.sent3: The leafworms formed a leaf-eating army, marching through the garden.
meanings.sent4: The leafworms swarmed the tree like a hungry horde, stripping it of its foliage.
meanings.sent5: The children watched in amazement as the leafworms transformed the garden into a leafless wonderland.
